Action.definition: a judicial proceeding for the enforcement or protection of a right
Action.origin: [Latin actio legal proceeding, from agere to do, carry out, initiate legal proceedings]

1 a.definition: a judicial proceeding for the enforcement or protection of a right, the redress or prevention of a wrong, or the punishment of a public offense compareat

sub_terms.b: the right to bring or maintain such a legal or judicial proceeding

2.definition: an act or decision by an executive or legislative body of a government (as an administrative agency) or of an organization (as a Board of Directors) [the power of courts to invalidate statutes and executive"R. H. Bork"]

3.definition: a voluntary act of will that manifests itself externallya mode of conduct
